title: Morbidly obese man cleared of raping woman he met on Match.com
text:

A "morbidly obese" man who slept with a woman on a Match.com date has been cleared of rape.

Christopher Schubert advertised himself online as a "big cuddly bear looking for his mate" before he met the woman at her Oxford home on January 30 last year.

Despite her initial shock that the 44-year-old did not resemble his online profile, the pair ended up having sex in her bed.

The single mum, who cannot be named for legal reasons, later told officers at a nearby police station that Mr Schubert had raped her.

(Image: Ric Mellis/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd)

Today at Oxford Crown Court a jury took four hours and four minutes to clear him of two counts of rape and two counts of assault by penetration following a four day trial.

During the hearing prosecutors told the court the woman, who was newly single, was surprised by Mr Schubert's large size and thought the two of them would not fit in her bed.

However, she invited him in for a chat over a cup of coffee.

(Image: Ric Mellis/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd)

The complainant described Mr Schubert as "morbidly obese" during her first police interview, his physical stature dashing earlier hopes she had of meeting a new partner.

During the interview where she wept while describing the rape offences, the woman said: "When he arrived, obviously I knew straight away that he didn't look like he did in his profile picture.

"To be honest with you, I thought: 's***, you're huge. You're absolutely huge'.

(Image: Ric Mellis/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd)

(Image: Ric Mellis/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd)

"I had already said we were not going to have sex. You end up getting to know someone over a cup of tea and I invited him in to be sociable.

"I thought he was going to have a cup of tea and chat."

Later in the trial, Mr Schubert took to the witness box to profess his innocence.

He said the woman "enjoyed" the intimacy and showed no signs she was not consenting.

(Image: PA Archive/Press Association Images)

After the verdicts were given Mr Schubert, of Orchard Close in Hail Weston, Cambridgeshire, broke down in tears and sobbed loudly.

Judge Nigel Daly told jurors: "As you can see trials with allegations such as these are very emotional affairs.

"It is something which is very difficult to do, we greatly appreciate you have come to this court as members of the public to try other members of the public.

"If you didn't do that then the criminal justice system simply could not continue."
description: Christopher Schubert from Hail Weston, in Cambridgeshire, was cleared of the charges in Oxford Crown Court today
